titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Pamela Sporn Papers TAM.708

repository.corpname: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives

did.abstract: Pamela Sporn is a documentary filmmaker whose films combine personal narratives and archival materials to tell stories about working-class life. The Pamela Sporn papers contain videos and research materials related to Sporn's documentaries. The bulk of the collection and consists of approximately 400 digital video files as well as research files created by Sporn for her film A Humble Giant: 70 Years Defending Immigrants and Radicals, about immigration lawyer Ira Gollobin. It also includes DVDs of Sporn's documentaries With a Stroke of the Chevata and Disobeying Orders: GI Resistance to the Vietnam War, and analog video footage of interviews from With a Stroke of the Chevata and A Humble Giant.
did.langmaterial: Materials are primarily in English. Materials relating to the film Con el toque de la chaveta are in English and Spanish.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Donated by Pamela Sporn in April 2017. The accession number associated with this gift is 2017.023.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection is arranged into three series: Series I. A Humble Giant media; Series II. A Humble Giant research and production files; Series III: Other projects. Files within each series are arranged alphabetically.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Pamela Sporn is a documentary filmmaker whose films combine personal narratives and archival materials to tell stories about working-class life. Sporn was the daughter of labor activists, leftist scholars, and American Communists. In 1964 her father Paul Sporn gained national attention after he was subpoenaed by the House Committee on Un-American Activities (HUAC), and was represented by Ira Gollobin who later inspired Pamela Sporn's work as a documentarian. Sporn's documentaries generally focus on political resistance and the working class. She has produced several documentaries through her production company Grito Productions, including Disobeying Orders: G. I. Resistance to The Vietnam War (1990); Remembering the Mamoncillo (2007), about Afro-Cuban culture in New York City; With a Stroke of the Chaveta (2007), about Cuban cigar factory workers; Detroit 48202: Conversations Along a Postal Route (2017); and A Humble Giant: Seventy Years Defending Immigrants and Radicals (still in production at the time of donation), about immigration lawyer and activist Ira Gollobin.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date; Pamela Sporn Papers; TAM 708; box number; folder number; Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives, New York University.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: At the time of accessioning a collection-level finding aid was created to describe materials in the collection. Born-digital records housed on a hard-drive were forensically imaged and partially inventoried.

In 2022 materials on the hard-drive were forensically analyzed and arranged in Forensic Toolkit. The original arrangement of born-digital files was retained and analog video cassettes were intellectually incorporated into Series I.
New York University Libraries follow professional standards and best practices when imaging, ingesting, and processing born-digital material in order to maintain the integrity of the content.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Pamela Sporn Papers consist of videos and research materials used by Pamela Sporn in her documentary films. The bulk of the collection consists of approximately 400 digital video files created by Sporn for her film A Humble Giant: 70 Years Defending Immigrants and Radicals, about immigration lawyer Ira Gollobin. These files include interviews and background footage from the documentary, which have been arranged by Sporn by individual and topic. There is also video footage from Ira Gollobin's 2008 memorial service and a 2005 National Lawyers Guild dinner. The collection also includes research files, budgets, fundraising, and promotional materials related to the production of the documentary. In addition to the digital video files, there are DVCAM and MiniDV cassettes that contain additional interviews.

The collection also contains DVDs of Sporn's documentaries With a Stroke of the Chaveta and Disobeying Orders: GI Resistance to the Vietnam War, both of which were produced by her small production company Grito Productions. The collection also includes MiniDV video cassettes of interviews Sporn conducted while producing With a Stroke of Chaveta, which documents the experiences of workers in Cuban cigar factories.

Other materials included in this collection consist of photocopies related to the website Unfriendly Witness: Standing Up to HUAC, which Sporn created to document her family's experience with the House Committee on Un-American Activities (HUAC).

phystech.head: Audiovisual Access Policies and Procedures
phystech.p: Audiovisual materials have not been preserved and may not be available to researchers. Materials not yet digitized will need to have access copies made before they can be used. To request an access copy, or if you are unsure if an item has been digitized, please contact tamiment.wagner@nyu.edu with the collection name, collection number, and a description of the item(s) requested. A staff member will respond to you with further information.

phystech.head: Born-Digital Access Policies and Procedures
phystech.p: An access terminal for born-digital materials in the collection is available by appointment for reading room viewing and listening only. Researchers may view an item's original container and/or carrier, but the physical carriers themselves are not available for use because of preservation concerns.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Copyright (or related rights to publicity and privacy) for materials in this collection, created by Pamela Sporn, was not transferred to New York University. Permission to use materials must be secured from the copyright holder.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: For more information about Ira Gollobin please see the Ira Gollobin Papers (TAM 278) and the Records of the American Committee for Protection of Foreign Born (TAM 086), both held by New York University Special Collections. There is also a collection of Ira Gollobin's papers at the New York Public Library Archives and Manuscripts (MssCol 6133).

did.unittitle: Series I: A Humble Giant media

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains video footage of interviews and events Pamela Sporn filmed for the documentary A Humble Giant about immigration attorney Ira Gollobin. Sporn interviewed Gollobin, his wife Ruth Gollobin, and some of his former clients and affiliates including Henry Foner, Bertell Ollman, Albert Socolov, and Sporn's father Paul Sporn. Topics covered include Gollobin's work with people who were targeted by the House Un-American Activities Committee (HUAC), immigrant rights activism, the Abraham Lincoln Brigade and the Spanish Civil War, and issues regarding the Labor movement and Leftist politics. Sporn also filmed much of Gollobin's memorial service which followed his death in 2008.
The video in this series was filmed digitally. In addition to video files that were stored on a harddrive there are also DVCAM and MiniDV cassettes.

did.unittitle: Series II: A Humble Giant research and production files

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series includes documents created in the process of planning the production of A Humble Giant and documents Sporn gathered while doing background research about Ira Gollobin. Planning documents include budgets, project descriptions, fundraising materials, production stills, and interview questions. Research files include both materials related directly to Ira Gollobin and materials related to his interests and areas of expertise such as immigration law, the House Un-American Activities Committee, Haiti, and the Spanish Civil War.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains copies of and footage from Pamela Sporn's films Disobeying Orders: G. I. Resistance to The Vietnam War and With a Stroke of the Chaveta. There is also a printed copy of Sporn's website titled "Unfriendly Witness: Standing Up to HUAC" which documented her family's experience with the House Un-American Activities Committee.
